name: Chickpea Spinach Pie with Berbere Spice
description: Chickpea Spinach Pie with Berbere Spice. Easy Chickpea Spinach Pastry for holidays and company with vegan puff pastry. Use spices or blends of choice. Use lentils for variation. Vegan Soy-free Nut-free Recipe.

ðŸ”—FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2017/10/chickpea-spinach-pie-berbere-spice.html

This ridiculously tasty pie is a breeze to put together. Use up those canned or cooked chickpeas or lentils, cook them up with the spices, onion and spinach. Make your own Ethiopian Berbere blend (see recipe on post) or use others. Fill up a thawed puff pastry sheets (many are accidentally vegan), seal and bake! 

The idea for this came about when I was thinking about making something like a Spanakopita but simpler. You can make one whole pie or small hand pies. Use any spices of choice or use the from scratch spice blends from my Everyday Kitchen book (Baharat (so good), Shawarma, Garam masala etc). Or use just herbs, a combination of thyme, sage and oregano + nooch. Add some tofu or almond ricotta for variation. Vegan Soy-free Nut-free Recipe.
To make it Gluten-free, use a gluten-free pie crust and bake the filling into a pie or make hand pies.

recipeIngredient: 1  small red onion (, thinly sliced or chopped)
3/4 tsp ground cumin  (, or 1/2 tsp cumin + 1/2 tsp coriander)
1/4 to 1/2 tsp cayenne or pepper flakes
a good dash of black pepper
15  oz can chickpeas (, or 1.5 cups cooked)
1/2 tsp salt (, less or more depending on if the chickpeas are salted)
1  bunchÂ Â of cilantro (chopped, or use more spinach)
1/2 cup non dairy milk ( + 1 tbsp flour)

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the Puff pastry sheets from the freezer and cover and let them rest at room temperature. Roll them out a bit if you like (optikonal) (they should be ready in about 20 to 25 minutes to use. Prep and make the filling in the meanwhile).
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the Puff pastry sheets from the freezer and cover and let them rest at room temperature. Roll them out a bit if you like (optikonal) (they should be ready in about 20 to 25 minutes to use. Prep and make the filling in the meanwhile).

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. When hot add onion and garlic and a pinch of salt. Cook until translucent. Add spices and mix well. Mash the chickpeas using a fork or a food processor and add to the skillet. Add salt and mix well. Cook for 4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. When hot add onion and garlic and a pinch of salt. Cook until translucent. Add spices and mix well. Mash the chickpeas using a fork or a food processor and add to the skillet. Add salt and mix well. Cook for 4 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the greens and mix in. Cook for 2 minutes. Taste and adjust salt and flavor.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the greens and mix in. Cook for 2 minutes. Taste and adjust salt and flavor.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the flour into the non dairy milk and add to the chickpeas. Cook for 2-3 minutes to bring to a boil and thicken. Let it cool for a few minutes. (This filling can be made ahead and used in the puff pastry, as a sandwich filling, or a dip with toasted pita. )
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the flour into the non dairy milk and add to the chickpeas. Cook for 2-3 minutes to bring to a boil and thicken. Let it cool for a few minutes. (This filling can be made ahead and used in the puff pastry, as a sandwich filling, or a dip with toasted pita. )

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the mixture on one puff pastry and place the other pastry sheet on top. Crimp the edges with a fork and use scissors to cut vents in. You can also make individual pastry pockets.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 400 degrees F for 20 to 24 mins for one large piece, 16 to 20 minutes for smaller. Let the pastry cool for 5 minutes, then slice and serve.
